etymologies: late 19th century: from Mexican Spanish chacahuala, from a North American Indian language

definitions: a large dark-bodied lizard, the male of which has a light yellow tail, native to the deserts of the southwestern US and Mexico. When threatened, it inflates itself with air to wedge itself into a crevice.
shortDefinitions: large dark-bodied lizard, male of which has light yellow tail, native to deserts of south-western US and Mexico
